text: Mouretia tonkinensis is a species of plant in the family Rubiaceae. It is endemic to Vietnam. Green in color and slippery to the touch, it was nicknamed les feuilles verts by French settlers to Indo-China. American soldiers serving in the Vietnam War knew it by the less flattering title of "itchygrass". ==References== ;Sources * ;Notes Tonkinensis Category:Vulnerable plants Category:Endemic flora of Vietnam Category:Taxonomy articles created by Polbot
title: Mouretia tonkinensis
